SVO.translation: kī'ere noti koe i mātau iāna

VSO.english sentence: I’ll give you some medicine to drink.
VSO.translation: e 'oka atu vou tī ta'i rā'au nā koe

koe.relational particularization: OBLIQUE ROLE DESTINATION of giving, AGENT of drinking

VSO.english sentence: We’ll try to catch some river fish for dinner.
VSO.translation: e tāmata māua e hī i te ika 'ī kai nō tō pō nei

VSO.english sentence: My wife had bought a chicken at the market the other day
VSO.translation: kā ho'o mai tōku tokorua pē'ā tī ta'i moa i te mākete tī ta'i ma'ana ra

VSO.english sentence: My husband and I, we have lots of vegetables from our garden.
VSO.translation: mē ngare ra tā māua mā'a tupu nō te fa'a'apu mai

m\u0101ua.relational particularization: AGENT of possessing, POSSESSOR of garden

VSO.translation: e 'oka mai kōrua tī ta'i mā'a tupu nā māua

VSO.english sentence: and we’ll give you some fish.
VSO.translation: e 'e 'oka atu māua te ika nā kōrua

VSO.english sentence: The people of X will sing their songs, dance their dances;
VSO.translation: e hīmene te tangata nō x i tā rātou noti hīmene 'e e 'ori 'oki mai rātou tā rātou 'ori
mē au ra nā te tangata te 'īmene 'e te kori

VSO.english sentence: Then our elders will tell stories from the olden times, for the young to hear.
VSO.translation: 'ia oti ana'e, e fa'ati'a tō tātou pu'era'a 'ina'ina tā tātou 'anga 'akaeoroero nā te taurekareka
i kite 'ēna koe tō puta ra

VOS.translation: e ka'u roa te tangata te ka'u maitataki ra

OVS.english sentence: Here is an old photo album I just found in my parents’ room.
OVS.translation: rā, kōta'i pu'e hoho'a tahito kite'ia e au i roto i te piha o tōku karakua

pu'e.relational particularization: PRESENT X of PRESENT X, PATIENT of finding

hoho'a.relational particularization: PRESENT X of PRESENT X, PATIENT of finding

kite'ia.internal particularization: EVENT TENSE: JUST A MOMENT AGO

OVS.english sentence: now we have nothing left at home!
OVS.translation: kāre ake 'aka'ou ho'i ïa e kai tā mātou tō te 'are

OVS.english sentence: After that, we’ll all share lunch together.

OSV.translation: mē ngare pa'i te 'akaeroero tā rātou i kite

SV.english sentence: This time, the people from village X will all be coming to our community.
SV.translation: tō mata'iti nei, nā te tangata o x e haere mai i kō nei

VS.english sentence: They died before I was born.
and then I wake up in the middle of the night.
VS.translation: e ara atu ai vou 'ia tae te pō

VS.english sentence: But every time I wake up, I’m very thirsty.
VS.translation: 'ia ti'a ana'e rā vou, e kōta'e tāku e hina'aro

vou.relational particularization: AGENT of experiencing in the body

VS.english sentence: Well, we’re walking down to the river, over there.
VS.translation: e naku na māua i te māngāvai, i kō rā

Adjective-Noun.english sentence: In those times, the engagement was a major event for the whole family,
Adjective-Noun.translation: tō tau ra, mē faufa'a roa ra te mōmo'a. e 'ōro'a tā'ato'a nō te fēti'i

Adjective-Noun.english sentence: And who is the small boy behind her?
Adjective-Noun.translation: 'o vai ïa tō kororio tamariki i muri mai

Adjective-Noun.english sentence: And what school did they attend then?
Adjective-Noun.translation: tē 'ea ra ïa 'are 'aikete'anga tā rāua i naku i muri ake

naku.internal particularization: EVENT TENSE: A LONG TIME AGO

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: Here is an old photo album I just found in my parents’ room.
Noun-Adjective.translation: rā, kōta'i pu'e hoho'a tahito kite'ia e au i roto i te piha o tōku karakua

pu'e.relational particularization: PRESENT X of PRESENT X, PATIENT of finding

hoho'a.relational particularization: PRESENT X of PRESENT X, PATIENT of finding

kite'ia.internal particularization: EVENT TENSE: JUST A MOMENT AGO

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: Who’s this on that first photo?
Noun-Adjective.translation: 'o vai terā ra i runga tō hoho'a mātāmua na rā

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: These are my grandparents, on my mother’s side.
Noun-Adjective.translation: tōku 'ina'ina terā ra, i te pae o tōku karakua pē'ā

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: Grandpa here on the left, and Grandma on the right.
Noun-Adjective.translation: tōku 'ina'ina rua tēnei ra 'e tōku 'ina'ina pē'ā terā ra

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: Was that the day of their wedding?
Noun-Adjective.translation: te ma'ana terā o tō raua 'akaipoipo'anga

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: This must have been the day when they got engaged.
Noun-Adjective.translation: te ma'ana pa'a terā ra o tō raua mōmo'a
e ka'u roa te tangata te ka'u maitataki ra

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: That was an old school that doesn’t exist anymore.
Well, on that photo you’re a small child,
Noun-Adjective.translation: noa atu e tamariki rikiriki ta'anga na koe i kōnei,
terā pa'i puta nūmēra ra tāku

Noun-Adjective.english sentence: Now I need to buy a new notebook

Demonstrative-Noun.english sentence: Who’s this on that first photo?
Demonstrative-Noun.translation: 'o vai terā ra i runga tō hoho'a mātāmua na rā

Noun-Demonstrative.english sentence: This woman is surely your mother again, carrying a child on her back.
Noun-Demonstrative.translation: tō koe karakua pē'ā 'aka'ou pa'āia ānei terā e 'akatei ra ki te tamariki

karakua.relational particularization: AGENT of carrying, PATIENT of equating
